sect1.title: OIO vs NIO
sect1.para: When the expected number of open connections is not high, OIO is often faster than NIO.

sect1.title: Performance guidelines
sect1.para: Understanding how to configure &hotpotato; for a specific scenario can increase the effectiveness of this library.

sect1.title: Summary
sect1.para: In this chapter we covered the most important details of fine-tuning &hotpotato; to achieve maximum performance under different circumstances. In the next chapter, , we will look at the internals of the default implementations and understand why some of these configuration tweaks behave they way they do.
